summary: This document is a chain of emails from July 2021 between a Senior Paralegal at FedEx and an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York. The correspondence concerns identifying a FedEx records custodian to sign an affidavit and potentially testify at the upcoming trial of Ghislaine Maxwell, scheduled for November 2021 in New York. The emails reference a 2008 subpoena from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida and a former FedEx point of contact, Tracy Ferrara.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the upcoming trial in New York for which the FedEx records custodian testimony is being sought.

persons.name: Tracy Ferrara
persons.context: Identified as the FedEx point of contact for a subpoena from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida in February 2008.

persons.name: Erin Markevitch
persons.context: A contractor who facilitated the initial contact between the FedEx paralegal and the Assistant U.S. Attorney.

persons.name: Andrew
persons.context: An Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York who is leading the effort to secure a FedEx records custodian for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

connections.description: Andrew, an AUSA for SDNY, is prosecuting the case against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.
Erin Markevitch, a contractor, is working with and facilitating contact for AUSA Andrew.
Erin Markevitch reached out to the Senior Paralegal at FedEx to connect them with AUSA Andrew.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Trial Scheduled
events.description: The criminal trial for Ghislaine Maxwell is scheduled to start in New York.

events.title: 2008 Subpoena to FedEx
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida sent a subpoena to FedEx.

keyFacts: In July 2021, prosecutors for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial were seeking a FedEx records custodian to sign an affidavit and potentially testify.
The email chain reveals investigative efforts to authenticate FedEx records, possibly related to evidence in the Maxwell case.
The correspondence references a prior 2008 subpoena from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida to FedEx, connecting the current NY case to earlier Florida investigations.
A FedEx Senior Paralegal confirmed the records in question 'seem to be our records' and inquired if the case was related to 'the' Jeffrey Epstein.
The document shows coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York and corporate records custodians in preparation for trial.
